author: @andaluciainf
title: El Lenovo Tenerife gana en Granada y sigue vivo en la pelea por la Copa | Andaluc√≠a Informaci√≥n. Todas las noticias de Huelva
text: El Lenovo Tenerife logr√≥ su octava victoria de la temporada y se jugar√° sus opciones de disputar la Copa del Rey en la √∫ltima jornada de la primera vuelta, al vencer este jueves en el Palacio de los Deportes de Granada por 68-80 al Covir√°n Granada, que pone fin a su racha de buenos resultados aunque sigue fuera de los puestos de descenso. El Lenovo Tenerife empez√≥ mejor el partido (4-8, m.3) ante un Covir√°n Granada que tom√≥ la delantera con su acierto cerca del aro (14-10, m.7) y que fue capaz de acabar por encima en el marcador el igualado primer cuarto (18-17). El acierto del serbio Dusan Ristic dio ventaja a los visitantes (23-28, m.15 tras once puntos seguidos del balc√°nico), renta ampliada porque a los locales les costaba un mundo anotar ante la buena defensa tinerfe√±a (28-38, m.18 y segundo tiempo en el cuarto pedido por Pablo Pin). El Lenovo Tenerife lleg√≥ al descanso mandando en el partido por 30-38 tras ser mejor y estar m√°s acertado en ataque que el cuadro andaluz. La gran defensa sobre el estadounidense Joe Thomasson, la estrella local, y la buena lectura del juego en ataque con un gran Marcelinho Huertas permiti√≥ al Lenovo Tenerife ampliar a√∫n m√°s su renta en el tercer cuarto (35-50, m.24). El Covir√°n Granada reaccion√≥ con un parcial de 10-0 (45-50, m.29), aunque los de Txus Vidorreta se repusieron levemente para entrar en el cuarto final con nueve puntos de ventaja (45-54). La buena defensa de los locales les meti√≥ del todo en el partido (57-59, m.34), con los visitantes agarrados a los puntos del estadounidense Elgin Cook para poder respirar (57-64, m.36). El Covir√°n Granada fall√≥ los triples que pod√≠an haber provocado un final igualado y el Lenovo Tenerife control√≥ a la perfecci√≥n los minutos definitivos y supo jugar con su ventaja guiados por un sensacional Marcelinho Huertas. -- Ficha t√©cnica: 68 - Covir√°n Granada (18+12+15+23): Rousselle (4), Thomasson (10), Tom√°s (7), Cheatham (16), Felicio (7) -quinteto inicial- D√≠az (5), Kramer (7), Mart√≠nez (2), Kairys (10), Iriarte (0). 80 - Lenovo Tenerife (17+21+16+26): Huertas (20), Salin (8), Cook (12), Doornekamp (7), Shermadini (8) -quinteto inicial- Fern√°ndez (4), Fitipaldo (2), Ristic (11), Sastre (0), Abromaitis (8). √Årbitros: Antonio Conde, Jorge Mart√≠nez y Vicente Mart√≠nez. Sin eliminados por faltas personales. Incidencias: Partido correspondiente a la decimoquinta jornada de la Liga Endesa disputado en el Palacio de los Deportes de Granada ante 8.083 espectadores, seg√∫n cifra oficial. Env√≠a tu noticia a: [participa@andaluciainformacion.es](mailto:participa@andaluciainformacion.es)

author: Helge Schutz
title: Namibia through to girls u16 semis
text:
Namibia reached the girls u16 semifinals of the ITF African Junior Tennis team championships which are currently underway in Windhoek.
Despite losing 3-0 to Zimbabwe on Thursday, Namibia reached the semis after finishing second behind Zimbabwe in Group A, after previously beating Mozambique 2-1 and Lesotho 3-0.
In Thursday‚Äôs matches against Zimbabwe, Mari van Schalkwyk lost 6-1, 6-4 to Chanelle Zhuwakini; Joanivia Bezuidenhout lost 6-1, 6-1 to Simphiwe Malunguza; and Van Schalkwyk and Natalia-Tia Ouses lost 6-4, 4-6, 10-8 to Malunguza and Rutendo Mavhenyengwa in the doubles.
In the boys u16 category South Africa will take on Botswana in Friday‚Äôs semifinals, while Zimbabwe will take on Mozambique at the Central Tennis Courts.
South Africa beat both Mauritius and Mozambique 3-0 to finish on top of Group B, while Zimbabwe beat Namibia 2-1, Botswana 3-0 and Lesotho 3-0 to finish on top of Group A.
Namibia finished third in Group B after beating Lesotho 3-0, but losing 2-1 top both Zimbabwe and Botswana.
In Thursday‚Äôs matches against Zimbabwe, Lian Kuhn lost 6-2, 6-2 to Tendekai Musabaeka and Dante Marcus lost 6-2, 6-2 to Noah Samushonga, while Kuhn and Luan Brand beat Musabaeka and Samushonga 6-0, 3-6, 10-6 in the doubles.
In the boys u14 category, South Africa will take on Botswana, while Zimbabwe will take on Madagascar in Friday‚Äôs semifinals.
Zimbabwe finished on top of Group A after winning all their matches 3-0 against Botswana, Mauritius, Lesotho and Eswatini, while South Africa finished on top of Group B after 3-0 victories against Madagascar, Namibia and Angola.
Namibia failed to make the semis after finishing third in Group B with one win and two defeats. They lost their opening two matches 3-0 to South Africa and 2-1 to Lesotho, but came storming back in style on Thursday when they beat Angola 3-0 without dropping a game.
Johan Theron beat Marco Silva 6-0, 6-0; Tadiwa Mombeyarara beat Italo Tuluca 6-0, 6-0, and Theron and Mombeyarara beat Silva and Tuluca 6-0, 6-0.
In the girls u14 category, South Africa will take on Botswana while Zimbabwe will face Lesotho in Friday‚Äôs semifinals.
South Africa finished on top of Group B after beating both Lesotho and Namibia 3-0; while Zimbabwe finished on top of Group A after beating Botswana 2-1, Angola 3-0 and Mozambique 3-0.
Namibia finished bottom of Group B after losing 3-0 to both South Africa and Lesotho.

author: perezhilton
title: Kim Kardashian Training For WHAT?! Why She's Started SUPER Intense Workouts Lately!
text:
Kim Kardashian is putting in hours at the gym!
Related: Taylor Swift‚Äôs Strict Diet & Workout For The Eras Tour!
On Instagram Thursday, the reality TV star took to her Stories to share a new video of herself working out with her sister Khlo√© Kardashian ‚Äî and WOW, she‚Äôs going super intense with these new routines! In the caption of the video, she wrote:
‚ÄúWorkouts w @khloehardashian really do it for me ‚Äú
It seems like her little sis makes a great coach, considering throughout the video she gasped and said:
‚ÄúOh my god!‚Äù
The Good American co-founder pushes Kimmy Kakes a step further and asked:
‚ÄúWhat are you training for?‚Äù
The SKIMS founder, in between lifting weights, quickly told her that she was training for ‚Äúlife‚Äù ‚Äî but KoKo had other ideas! She argued:
‚ÄúThe Olympics! ‚Ä¶ Holy f**k you‚Äôre gonna f**k me up later!‚Äù
Ch-ch-check out her incredible muscles (below):
(c) Kim Kardashian/Instagram (c) Kim Kardashian/Instagram AH-Mazing!!
While Kim never confirmed nor denied she was reaching for the stars with Olympics -level goals (hey, she tried to be a lawyer so ya never know!), it‚Äôs apparent she‚Äôs pushing herself to the limit in the new year! On Friday, the 43-year-old added several more videos to her Stories, filmed by her trainer Senada Greca . Throughout the clips, The Kardashians star shows off her ‚Äúleg day‚Äù routine, including hamstring curls, step-ups, and hip thrusts.
In one caption, the socialite encouraged her followers to follow their new years resolutions just like she is:
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre going for heavier weights this year. Set small fitness goals and stick with them.‚Äù
Kim isn‚Äôt holding back when it comes to staying fit and fresh in 2024! Reactions to her strict new workout, Perezcious readers?
[Image via Kim Kardashian/Instagram ]

author: Tony; Anna Green
title: Christ‚Äôs Corner: Remembering those who have fallen
text:
Hebrews 11: 13 (ESV)
"These all died in faith, not having received the things promised, but having seen them and greeted them from afar, and having acknowledged that they were strangers and exiles on the earth."
For most of the country, Memorial Day weekend is more than a long weekend without work. It is not just about backyard barbecues with family and friends‚Äîit is a weekend of remembrance. All those things are good and important, bringing joy, fellowship, and the celebration of freedom; however, it is most important to remember that lives were lost for those freedoms.
Our men and women who have served in the United States armed forces have sacrificed everything for this country's freedom. Throughout the decades, hundreds of thousands have died in faith, believing in the freedoms we enjoy and experience. We are the most blessed country in the world, and God has raised up men and women to serve and protect us and our freedoms.
It is very important that we remember the men, women, fathers, mothers, sons, and daughters who have given their lives for this country. Let us not just remember but pray for and support the families of those who have lost loved ones in the service of our country. These are our family members, our friends, our next-door neighbors, and our brothers and sisters in Christ.
Christ‚Äôs Corner honors you and thanks you for your faithful service!
God Bless!
Tony and Anna Green

author: ElNacional.cat
title: Marta Rovira en tornar de l'exili: "Aix√≤ √©s una vict√≤ria, hem vingut a acabar la feina que vam co...
text: ‚ÄúHem guanyat, aix√≤ d‚Äôavui √©s una vict√≤ria absoluta i ho hem de celebrar. Fa massa dies que l‚Äôindependentisme no celebra res, aix√≤ ha de ser un doll d‚Äôenergia positiva". Aquestes han estat les primeres paraules de Marta Rovira en tornar a trepitjar Catalunya, a Cantallops, on l'independentisme ha celebrat l'acte de rebuda de la secret√†ria general d'ERC i de la resta d'exiliats que van tornar ahir de Su√Øssa: Ruben Wagesberg, Jes√∫s Rodr√≠guez i Oleguer Serra. Rovira ha comen√ßat el seu discurs molt emocionant de poder tornar a ser a Catalunya, nom√©s pocs dies despr√©s de saber que podria abandonar Su√Øssa en el moment en qu√® el jutge Garc√≠a-Castell√≥n va [arxivar la causa del Tsunami](https://www.elnacional.cat/ca/politica/jutge-garcia-castellon-tira-tovallola-arxiva-cas-tsunami_1249397_102.html). Tot i aquesta emoci√≥ inicial, el to de Rovira ha anat guanyant for√ßa i despr√©s de reivindicar aquesta vict√≤ria tamb√© ha deixat clar que l'exili els ha fet m√©s forts i sobretot m√©s conven√ßuts de continuar lluitant per la independ√®ncia de Catalunya. Les primeres paraules de‚Äî ElNacional.cat (@elnacionalcat) [@martarovira]a Catalunya entre ll√†grimes d'emoci√≥: üí¨ "Havia somiat moltes vegades aquest moment, per√≤ no ens l'han deixat ni preparar, estem feli√ßos de ser a casa" [pic.twitter.com/uggYP5RdTb] [July 12, 2024] "Hem vingut aqu√≠ per acabar la feina que vam deixar a mitges, per tornar a recomen√ßar. Quin dia se‚Äôns va acudir debatre d'aquesta manera que ho estem fent? Aix√≤ ho hem vingut a acabar. Estem aqu√≠ carregades amb m√©s raons que mai per arribar fins al final. Visca Catalunya, cap a la rep√∫blica, sense parar, infinitament, fins a la nostra llibertat i la del nostre poble!", ha exclamat la secret√†ria general d'ERC entre aplaudiments en un discurs ple d'emocions. Euf√≤ria, abra√ßades i crits Ha estat aix√≠, un mat√≠ d'euf√≤ria, abra√ßades i crits d'independ√®ncia a Cantallops, on els exiliats de Ginebra s'han retrobat amb els seus amics i familiars. En el cas de [ Marta Rovira](https://www.elnacional.cat/ca/politica/marta-rovira-torna-catalunya-despres-sis-anys-exili-suissa-en-moment-mes-complicat-erc_1251233_102.html), √©s la primera vegada que trepitja Catalunya despr√©s de m√©s de sis anys a Su√Øssa, on va marxar el mar√ß del 2018, el mateix dia en qu√® va ser imputada per sedici√≥ pel jutge del proc√©s. Despr√©s d'una primera abra√ßada amb les seves amigues de Vic, la primera persona amb qui s'ha abra√ßat Rovira en aquest acte quan passaven pocs minuts de les nou del mat√≠, ha estat Oriol Junqueras. Una abra√ßada llarga i carregada de simbolisme, m√©s tenint en compte el delicat moment pel qual passa el partit que han dirigit durant m√©s d'una d√®cada. Cantallops, el poble de la fam√≠lia d'un Ruben Wagensberg que tampoc no ha amagat en cap moment la seva emoci√≥, ha estat l'escollit per fer la rebuda de Marta Rovira i la resta d'exiliats en el seu retorn a Catalunya despr√©s de sis anys en el cas de la secret√†ria general d'ERC a l'exili. Aquest petit poble de l'Empord√† i a prop de la frontera s'ha omplert per rebre cinc persones que han hagut de viure lluny de Catalunya en els √∫ltims mesos o anys per la investigaci√≥ del Tsunami (molts pensaven que Rovira podria tornar a principis de 2023 quan es va eliminar el delicte de sedici√≥ per√≤ no ho va fer en assegurar que no tenia garanties), moltes de les quals portaven estelades. Tal com ha explicat Rovira, tamb√© hi havia persones que han conegut en els seus anys d'exili a Su√Øssa i que han viatjat a Catalunya per fer-los costat. Primeres abra√ßades a la Catalunya Nord Despr√©s d'hores de viatge des de Ginebra, d'on van sortir dijous a la tarda, a primera hora del mat√≠ d'aquest divendres, els exiliats han entrat als Pa√Øsos Catalans, travessant la seva porta a Salses on els esperaven unes 200 persones, entre les quals representants de tots els partits, i de les entitats amb qui s'han fos en abra√ßades. Amb una senyera i crits d'independ√®ncia, ha estat un moment emocionant en qu√® tant exiliats com aquells que els han anat a rebre no han pogut evitar alguna ll√†grima. Entre aquestes persones hi havia Llu√≠s Puig, un dels tres exiliats que queden, amb Carles Puigdemont i Toni Com√≠n. Despr√©s de passar per Vic, la seva ciutat i on a la pla√ßa Major encara llueix una pancarta amb la seva cara, Rovira arribar√† a Barcelona per ser present a l'executiva nacional del partit i en el Consell Nacional que se celebrar√† posteriorment per resoldre l' [afer dels cartells contra els germans Maragall](https://www.elnacional.cat/ca/politica/erc-tancara-divendres-investigacio-interna-sobre-escandol-cartells-maragall_1249169_102.html), que han acabat d'esmitjar un partit que ja estava dividit per la crisi interna. El retorn de Rovira, que √©s qui dirigeix les negociacions amb el PSC per la investidura de Salvador Illa, podrien ser un b√†lsam inesperat pel partit fa nom√©s una setmana i que ajudi a reconduir la situaci√≥. [ElNacional.cat a WhatsApp](https://www.whatsapp.com/channel/0029VaCpAjh0gcfJ0q12kP15), hi trobar√†s tota l'actualitat, en un clic!

author: Geri Mileva
title: Passionate gardener issues warning about seemingly innocent backyard plant: 'It's a never-ending job' - NewsBreak
text: A passionate home gardener issued a serious warning on TikTok , and it's all about a seemingly innocent, and even beautiful, backyard plant that wreaks havoc on ecosystems: Chinese privet. In one of her videos, TikTok creator Lil Urban Farm (@lilurbanfarm) shares her frustration with the aggressively invasive shrub . "This tree behind me ‚Äî it looks really pretty in the spring. It flowers. It's called a privet. Do not plant them!" she urged. She explains that this invasive species , which expands its range via birds and grows just about anywhere, takes over the undergrowth of forested areas. In the clip, she points out a thick patch of regrowth, frustrated by how relentless the plant can be. Chinese privet (Ligustrum sinense) is considered one of the most aggressive invasive species in the Southeastern United States. It forms dense thickets that crowd out native plants , reduce biodiversity, and strain ecosystems. For homeowners, removing it can be a long and frustrating process requiring pulling of seedlings, herbicide applications, or professional help. Instead of planting invasive species, experts recommend choosing native plants that thrive in local climates and promote biodiversity, including American cyrilla and sweetbay magnolia . Native landscaping reduces maintenance and water usage, which lowers monthly bills. It also supports pollinators such as bees and butterflies, which are essential to maintaining our food supply. Other eco-friendly alternatives to Chinese privet include a clover lawn or buffalo grass , both of which provide significant benefits such as boosting biodiversity (clover flowers are a good source of nectar for pollinators) and binding soil to prevent erosion. Xeriscaping , a type of landscaping designed to minimize water usage, is also a great alternative that supports water conservation . Even replacing a portion of traditional turf grass with native plants can benefit local ecosystems and pollinators. Homeowners looking to make that switch can explore landscaping ideas designed to make the transition easier. Commenters echoed the creator's frustrations. Should we be actively working to kill invasive species? Absolutely It depends on the species I don't know No ‚Äî leave nature alone Click your choice to see results and speak your mind. "Privet is good if you need a full-time job of pulling seedlings. I stupidly put a hedge in of them," one wrote. Another said: "95% of the clearing I'm doing by hand on the land I've been allowed to manage behind my house is privet and Bradford pears. It's a never-ending job." Join our free newsletter for easy tips to save more and waste less , and don't miss this cool list of easy ways to help yourself while helping the planet. Passionate gardener issues warning about seemingly innocent backyard plant: 'It's a never-ending job' first appeared on The Cool Down .

author: Anonym
title: More than 40% of local governments in Tokyo are delayed by several months in providing guidance for people with developmental disabilities. - Teller Report
text: Due to problems with the testing system, more than 40% of local governments in Tokyo have not been able to use the ``class guidance,'' in which children with developmental disabilities learn how to overcome difficulties in learning and daily life at school, for a few months. I understand that there is a delay. Some children are refusing to go to school, and experts say, ``We need to urgently improve support.'' The number of children who may have developmental disabilities is increasing year by year, and is estimated to account for 8.8% of children in elementary and junior high schools nationwide, or about 1 in 11 children. As a form of special needs education for these children, the government is calling for the enhancement of "interclass instruction," in which children are moved to a different classroom several times a week to learn how to overcome difficulties in learning and life. I am. NHK conducted a survey of all 62 local governments in Tokyo regarding the current situation, and received responses from 56 local governments. Of these, 24 local governments, more than 40% of the total, answered that it would take several months to use the system due to problems with the testing system, which is a condition of "passing guidance" in Tokyo. Local governments have made comments such as, ``We test almost every day, but the waiting list for reservations is three months,'' and ``It takes about four months to get tested, and it can take up to six months to use the service.'' Additionally, seven local governments responded that it would take several months to use the service due to chronic teacher shortages. Experts point out that, ``Even if support is delayed for a few months, some children will have trouble with their relationships at school and stop attending school.The government should enhance support.'' Expert: ‚ÄúIt is important to enhance support‚Äù Regarding the results of this survey, Hirohito Ozeki, president of the National Association of Heads of Schools with Special Needs Classes and Day-to-Day Guidance Classes, said, ``If the timing of support is missed, failures in school life can lead to heartbreak, and interpersonal relationships can be very difficult.'' "Some children develop secondary disabilities, such as not going to school or having difficulty leaving their rooms," he said. He also said, ``School life is a limited time for children, one month or one year, so it is important to create an environment where children can receive the education they need.'' I did. He added, ``Some developmental tests can be cleared with administrative budgetary measures, so it is important to enhance support.Also, with regard to the shortage of teachers, the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology has announced that the number of applicants for classroom instruction increases in the middle of the academic year. We should allocate teachers based on the situation." Children waiting for regular instruction Mika (pseudonym), a 5th grade elementary school student living in Tokyo, is unable to take a test right away and is waiting for guidance. Although she is good at math and physical education, she is not good at reading and writing kanji, and she tends to have a learning disability, which is a type of developmental disorder. In his regular classes, when there were reading aloud and kanji tests in Japanese class, he was teased and told that he was a slow reader. Looking back, Mika's mother says, ``It would have been nice to have had support like, ``It will be easier if you write the pronunciation in your textbook,'' or ``If you don't know where you're reading, just draw a line.'' . Because of this, her mother contacted the local government to ask Mika to take advantage of day-to-day instruction starting in fifth grade, but she says the test date and time she wanted was fully booked. Since last summer, she has hardly been able to go to school and is unable to participate in club volleyball activities, which she loved. Mika said that she may not be able to go to school because she was traumatized by her slow reading ability.I hope she can go to school by the time she gets to the 6th grade. Ta. Her mother said, ``I think it's most important that people get support while they're still trying to do their best.If they wait, they'll give up, and it's a shame.'' .
